events.event_description: The Gemini solar and storage facility with 690-MW capacity came online in Nevada, marking one of the largest solar projects in early 2024.
events.citation: The 690-megawatt (MW) solar and storage Gemini facility in Nevada and the 653-MW Lumina Solar Project in Texas were the largest solar projects that came online in the first six months of 2024.

events.event_description: Unit 4 (1,114 MW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant began commercial operations, making it the largest nuclear facility in the United States.
events.citation: Unit 4 (1,114 MW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant began commercial operations in April, making Vogtle the largest nuclear facility in the United States and the only one with four nuclear power reactors.

events.event_description: Seminole Electric Cooperative's Unit 1 (626.0 MW) coal plant in Florida retired.
events.citation: The largest U.S. coal retirements include Seminole Electric Cooperative's Unit 1 (626.0 MW) in Florida, which retired in January

events.event_description: Homer City Generating Station's Unit 1 (626.1 MW) coal plant in Pennsylvania retired.
events.citation: Homer City Generating Station's Unit 1 (626.1 MW) in Pennsylvania, which retired in April.

events.event_description: The Mystic Generating Station, New England's third-largest power plant with 1,413-MW capacity, retired.
events.citation: The six-unit, 1,413-MW Mystic Generating Station combined-cycle facility in Massachusetts was the largest natural gas retirement this year and had been the third-largest power plant in New England.

events.event_description: U.S. power developers added 20.2 gigawatts of new electric generating capacity in the first half of 2024, representing a 21% increase from the same period in 2023.
events.citation: According to our latest Preliminary Monthly Electric Generator Inventory, developers and power plant owners added 20.2 gigawatts (GW) of utility-scale electric generating capacity in the United States during the first half of 2024. This new capacity is 3.6 GW (21%) more than the capacity added during the first six months of 2023.
